org.corfudb.runtime.view.stream

Class AbstractContextStreamView<T extends AbstractStreamContext>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.corfudb.runtime.view.stream.AbstractContextStreamView<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Iterator<ILogData>, IStreamView
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractQueuedStreamView

    public abstract class AbstractContextStreamView<T extends AbstractStreamContext>
extends Object
implements IStreamView, AutoCloseable
    An abstract context stream view maintains contexts, which are used to implement copy-on-write entries. This implementation uses "contexts" to properly deal with copy-on-write streams. Every time a stream is copied, a new context is created which redirects requests to the source stream for the copy - each context contains its own queue and pointers. Implementers of fillReadQueue() and readAndUpdatePointers should be careful to use the id of the context, rather than that of the stream view itself. Created by mwei on 1/6/17.

        public final ILogData nextUpTo(long maxGlobal)
        Retrieve the next entry from this stream, up to the address given or the tail of the stream. If there are no entries present, this function will return NULL. If there are holes present in the log, they will be filled.
        Specified by:
        nextUpTo in interface IStreamView
        Parameters:
        maxGlobal - The maximum global address to read up to.
        Returns:
        The next entry in the stream, or NULL, if no entries are available.

      • remainingUpTo

        public final List<ILogData> remainingUpTo(long maxGlobal)
        Retrieve all of the entries from this stream, up to the address given or the tail of the stream. If there are no entries present, this function will return an empty list. If there are holes present in the log, they will be filled.
        Specified by:
        remainingUpTo in interface IStreamView
        Parameters:
        maxGlobal - The maximum global address to read up to.
        Returns:
        The next entries in the stream, or an empty list, if no entries are available.

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Returns whether or not there are potentially more entries in this stream - this function may return true even if there are no entries remaining, as addresses may have been acquired by other clients but not written yet, or the addresses were hole-filled, or just failed.
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface Iterator<ILogData>
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface IStreamView
        Returns:
        True, if there are potentially more entries in the stream.

        Parameters:
        context - The context to retrieve the next entry from.
        maxGlobal - The maximum global address to read to.

      • getNextEntries

        protected List<ILogData> getNextEntries(T context,
                                        long maxGlobal,
                                        Function<ILogData,Boolean> contextCheckFn)
        Retrieve the next entries in the stream, given the context. This function is designed to implement a bulk read. In a bulk read, one of the entries may cause the context to change - the implementation should check if the entry changes the context and stop reading if this occurs, returning the entry that caused contextCheckFn to return true. The default implementation simply calls getNextEntry.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to retrieve the next entry from.
        maxGlobal - The maximum global address to read to.
        contextCheckFn - A function which returns true if the entry changes the stream context.
        Returns:

      • doesEntryUpdateContext

        protected boolean doesEntryUpdateContext(ILogData data)
        Check whether the given entry updates the context.
        Parameters:
        data - The entry to check.
        Returns:
        True, if the entry will update the context.

      • updatePointer

        protected void updatePointer(ILogData data)
        Update the global pointer, given an entry.
        Parameters:
        data - The entry to use to update the pointer.

      • processEntryForContext

        protected boolean processEntryForContext(ILogData data)
        Check if the given entry adds a new context, and update the global pointer. If it does, add it to the context stack. Otherwise, pop the context. It is important that this method be called in order, since it updates the global pointer and can change the global pointer.
        Parameters:
        data - The entry to process.
        Returns:
        True, if this entry adds a context.

      • getCurrentContext

        protected T getCurrentContext()
        Get the current context. Should never throw a NoSuchElement exception because streamContexts should always at least have one element.
